content:
Abstract expressionism is a fascinating art movement! Pollock and Rothko are indeed giants in that field, and it's wonderful that Dr. Patel's tour helped you appreciate their work on a deeper level. Abstract art can be challenging to understand, but with the right guidance, it can be incredibly rewarding.

Keep an eye out for exhibitions that explore the emotional and psychological aspects of abstract expressionism. Many museums also offer interactive programs, workshops, or lectures that can further enhance your understanding and appreciation of this art movement.

If you're interested in learning more about Pollock and Rothko, you might also want to explore other artists associated with the abstract expressionist movement, such as Willem de Kooning, Franz Kline, and Clyfford Still. Their works often explored similar themes of emotion, gesture, and the subconscious.

Remember to also pay attention to the museum's permanent collection, as they may have pieces by these artists or other abstract expressionists on display. Enjoy your visit, and I hope you discover new favorites!
